meanings.definition: A knot or fastening made by looping a rope or cord upon itself and tightening it.
meanings.sent1: He tied a tye to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: The tye around the gift box kept it closed.
meanings.sent3: The tye on the balloon was so tight, it made a funny squeaky sound.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was like a tye, holding everything in place with precision.
meanings.sent5: The tye on his shoelaces was bright red, making them easy to spot.

meanings.definition: A band or cord used to fasten or secure something.
meanings.sent1: She used a colorful tye to hold her hair back.
meanings.sent2: The tye on the flag fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The tye on the present was so long, it wrapped around the room twice!
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was like a tye, unbreakable and strong.
meanings.sent5: The tye on the kite was so tight, it soared high in the sky.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a tye.
meanings.sent1: He needed to tye the boat to the dock to keep it from drifting away.
meanings.sent2: She would tye her scarf around her neck to stay warm.
meanings.sent3: He tried to tye his shoes together as a prank, but it backfired.
meanings.sent4: The promise to always be there would tye them together forever.
meanings.sent5: She would tye the curtains back to let the sunlight in every morning.
